intro: Saxifraga nayarii, commonly known as the Mexican saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually succulent, which helps it conserve water in its arid habitat. Saxifraga nayarii is often found in alpine meadows and is a member of the Saxifragaceae family.
